text: Amy Spurway is a Canadian writer, whose debut novel Crow was published in 2019.Brett Josef Grubisic, "Complex, capable comedy in Amy Spurway's debut novel". Toronto Star, March 21, 2019. The novel, a black comedy about a woman returning home to Cape Breton Island to reunite with her estranged family after being diagnosed with terminal brain cancer,Sarah Laing, "Amy Spurway's debut is ridiculous - and ridiculously good". The Globe and Mail, April 13, 2019. was a shortlisted finalist for the Stephen Leacock Memorial Medal for Humour in 2020.Ryan Porter, "Shortlist announced for Stephen Leacock Medal". Quill & Quire, May 4, 2020. Originally from the Cape Breton Regional Municipality, Spurway was educated at the University of New Brunswick and Ryerson University, and has also written for Today's Parent and the Toronto Star.Suzanne Rent, "Dartmouth author Amy Spurway debut novel Crow explores big questions about life". Halifax Chronicle-Herald, March 25, 2019.
